meanings.definition: A person who is younger or less experienced than another.
meanings.sent1: The juniors in the class looked up to the older students.
meanings.sent2: The new employee was considered a junior compared to the seasoned staff.
meanings.sent3: The juniors at the party were excited to learn from the experienced dancers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, he was a junior trying to catch up with the experts.
meanings.sent5: The juniors in the group were eager to gain more knowledge and skills.

meanings.definition: Students in their third year of study at a college or high school.
meanings.sent1: The juniors were preparing for their senior year with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: The juniors organized a fundraiser for the school's charity event.
meanings.sent3: The juniors decided to surprise the seniors with a special gift.
meanings.sent4: As juniors, they were halfway through their academic journey.
meanings.sent5: The juniors were excited about the upcoming prom night.

meanings.definition: A sports team or individual athlete competing at a lower level or age group.
meanings.sent1: The juniors won the championship in the youth soccer league.
meanings.sent2: The juniors were proud of their performance in the junior varsity competition.
meanings.sent3: The juniors celebrated their victory with a pizza party.
meanings.sent4: The juniors showed great potential for moving up to the senior division.
meanings.sent5: The juniors trained hard to improve their skills and beat the competition.
